excerpt: Former brick warehouse, now a shopping & cultural center with stores, cafes & seasonal events.
detail_description: Yokohama Red Brick Warehouse, also known as Aka Renga in Japanese, is a historic brick warehouse that has been transformed into a vibrant shopping and cultural center. Located in the Minato Mirai 21 district of Yokohama, it is surrounded by popular attractions such as the Yokohama Museum of Art, Cosmo World, and the Cup Noodle Museum.
name: Yokohama Red Brick Warehouse
address: 1 Chome-1 Shinko, Naka Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 231-0001, Japan

excerpt: Traditional Japanese garden opened in 1906, featuring historic buildings from around the country.
detail_description: Sankeien Garden, a traditional Japanese garden that opened its doors in 1906, is a serene escape into nature and history. Nestled in Yokohama, this enchanting space features two distinct gardens: the Outer Garden, which welcomes visitors with seasonal blooms and stunning views of a three-story pagoda originally from Kyoto's Tomyo-ji Temple, and the Inner Garden, an intimate area showcasing historical structures.
name: Sankeien Garden
address: 58-1 Honmokusannotani, Naka Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 231-0824, Japan

excerpt: Japan's largest Chinatown, with around 250 Chinese-owned stores & eateries & a colorful entry gate.
detail_description: Yokohama Chinatown is the largest of its kind in Japan, boasting around 250 Chinese-owned shops and restaurants, as well as a vibrant entry gate. Located near Shin-Yokohama Station on the Tokaido Shinkansen line, it serves as a major transportation hub for travelers. While not centrally located, the area offers convenient access to popular attractions via train services to Yokohama Station and other nearby stations.
name: Yokohama Chinatown
address: Yamashitacho, Naka Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 231-0023, Japan

excerpt: Child-friendly exhibits on creative thinking, instant ramen noodles & their inventor, Momofuku Ando.
detail_description: The Cup Noodles Museum Yokohama is a delightful destination that celebrates the fascinating world of instant ramen and its visionary creator, Momofuku Ando. Established by Nissin Food, the museum offers engaging exhibits that encourage creative thinking, making it perfect for families.
name: Cup Noodles Museum
address: 2 Chome-3-4 Shinko, Naka Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 231-0001, Japan

excerpt: Traditional street food court with shops offering samples of ramen dishes from different regions.
detail_description: The Shin-Yokohama Ramen Museum is a unique destination that offers a nostalgic experience of old Japan and the world of ramen. It features a traditional street food court with shops offering samples of ramen dishes from different regions, allowing visitors to taste and learn about the history of this beloved dish. The museum also has a theatre where performances about the history of ramen noodles are showcased.
name: Shin-Yokohama Ramen Museum
address: 2 Chome-14-21 Shinyokohama, Kohoku Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 222-0033, Japan

excerpt: Opened in 1930, this popular seaside park features flower beds & monuments, plus a fountain.
detail_description: Yamashita Park, established in 1930, is a charming seaside oasis that beckons visitors with its vibrant flower beds and impressive monuments. Nestled along the waterfront, this picturesque park offers stunning views of the city skyline, especially at night when the lights twinkle against the backdrop of the big wheel. With plenty of benches scattered throughout, it's an ideal spot for relaxation and people-watching.
name: Yamashita Park
address: 279 Yamashitacho, Naka Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 231-0023, Japan

excerpt: Family amusement park featuring a huge Ferris wheel, a high-speed roller coaster & other rides.
detail_description: Yokohama Cosmo World is a family-friendly amusement park with a variety of attractions, including a giant Ferris wheel and thrilling roller coasters. Additionally, the ASOBUILD complex offers entertainment for all ages, featuring an amusement bar lounge, gourmet street, sports court, artisan workshops, and a children's indoor theme park called Hapipi Land!
name: Yokohama Cosmo World
address: 2 Chome-8-1 Shinko, Naka Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 231-0001, Japan

excerpt: This huge tower with a hotel, mall & offices also has an observation area with 360-degree views.
detail_description: The Yokohama Landmark Tower is an iconic structure that stands tall in Japan, featuring a luxurious hotel, bustling mall, and modern office spaces. One of its highlights is the Sky Garden observation deck, where visitors can ascend in the country’s fastest elevator to enjoy breathtaking 360-degree views that stretch all the way to Tokyo and even majestic Mt. Fuji! The tower's stunning lights reflect beautifully on the bay waters below, creating a romantic atmosphere for couples strolling nearby.
name: Yokohama Landmark Tower
address: 2 Chome-2-1 Minatomirai, Nishi Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 220-0012, Japan

excerpt: Opened in 1993, this amusement park offers an aquarium with sealife shows, rides & a marina.
detail_description: Yokohama Hakkeijima Sea Paradise, established in 1993, is a well-known amusement park in Yokohama. It offers a wide range of attractions including an aquarium with sealife shows, various amusement rides, a marina, and a hotel.
name: Yokohama Hakkeijima Sea Paradise
address: Hakkeijima, Kanazawa Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 236-0006, Japan

excerpt: This sizable stadium built in 1978 is home to the Yokohama DeNA BayStars baseball team.
detail_description: Yokohama Stadium, established in 1978, serves as the home ground for the Yokohama DeNA BayStars baseball team. Situated in central Yokohama, it's an ideal spot to catch a thrilling baseball game while sipping on a refreshing Kirin beer. The stadium has a seating capacity of nearly 35,000 and hosts games from April to October, with tickets typically ranging from JPY2000 to JPY7000.
name: Yokohama Stadium
address: Yokohamakoen, Naka Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 231-0022, Japan

excerpt: Museum featuring a diverse collection, from Matisse to Picasso, plus contemporary Japanese artists.
detail_description: The Yokohama Museum of Art is a treasure trove for art enthusiasts, showcasing an impressive collection that spans from iconic masters like Matisse and Picasso to contemporary Japanese artists. This vibrant museum, established in 1989 and designed by renowned architect Kenzo Tange, offers over 10,000 works of art within its spacious and inviting environment.
name: Yokohama Museum of Art
address: 3 Chome-4-1 Minatomirai, Nishi Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 220-0012, Japan

excerpt: Yokohama, a Japanese city south of Tokyo, was one of the first Japanese ports opened to foreign trade, in 1859. It contains a large Chinatown with hundreds of Chinese restaurants and shops. It’s also known for Sankei-en Garden, a botanical park containing preserved Japanese residences from different eras, and the seaside Minato Mirai district, site of the 296m Landmark Tower.
detail_description: Yokohama, a historic Japanese port city, offers a blend of traditional and modern attractions. Its large Chinatown is home to numerous Chinese eateries and shops. The city boasts the Sankei-en Garden, featuring well-preserved Japanese residences from different periods, as well as the Minato Mirai district with the iconic Landmark Tower.
name: Yokohama
address: Kanagawa, Japan

excerpt: Sprawling zoo featuring a wide variety of animals in open-air habitat zones, plus play areas & eats.
detail_description: Zoorasia is a captivating zoo that offers visitors an immersive experience through its expansive open-air habitat zones, showcasing a diverse array of animals. This unique facility allows you to encounter rare species like okapis and Goodfellow's tree kangaroos while exploring exhibits organized by global climate zones. Each area—ranging from the lush Asian Tropical Forests to the vibrant African Tropical Rainforests—blends animal life with local flora and cultural elements, creating an authentic atmosphere reflective of each region.
name: Zoorasia
address: 1175-1 Kamishiranecho, Asahi Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 241-0001, Japan

excerpt: 1930 sailing vessel, now a museum offering period displays, school programs & full-sail exhibitions.
detail_description: Yokohama Port Museum, housed in a 1930 sailing vessel, has been open to the public since 1989 and offers period displays, school programs, and full-sail exhibitions. It is located on the waterfront and showcases artifacts from Yokohama's past as one of the world's most famous port cities.
name: Yokohama Port Museum
address: 2 Chome-1-1 Minatomirai, Nishi Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 220-0012, Japan

excerpt: Historic shopping district offering a variety of boutiques & cafes in a bustling, stylish setting.
detail_description: Yokohama Motomachi Shopping Street is a historic and vibrant district that has been around since 1859. It's a bustling area with stylish boutiques, cafes, and unique fashion retail stores spread along its 600-meter strip. The street is known for its festive atmosphere and hosts various seasonal events like Christmas/Winter illuminations and St. Patrick's Day parades.
name: Yokohama Motomachi Shopping Street
address: 1 Chome-８ Motomachi, Naka Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 231-0861, Japan

excerpt: Doll museum with galleries & exhibit halls on multiple floors, with a theater for puppet shows.
detail_description: Yokohama Doll Museum is a unique attraction housed in a building that incorporates the abandoned rails of the historic 'Rinko Line,' adding to its special atmosphere. Visitors can stroll along these embedded rails, offering a glimpse into the past and providing picturesque views of Minatomirai's skyscrapers and the iconic 'Cosmo Clock 21' Ferris wheel.
name: Yokohama Doll Museum
address: 1F, 18 Yamashitacho, Naka Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 231-0023, Japan

excerpt: Circa-1930 ocean liner that survived World War II, now restored as a maritime museum.
detail_description: The NYK Hikawa Maru is a stunning ocean liner that dates back to the 1930s and has an intriguing history, having served as a hospital ship during World War II. Now permanently moored in Yokohama's picturesque harbor near Yamashita Park, this majestic vessel has been transformed into a maritime museum. Visitors can explore its beautifully restored Art Deco interiors and historic cabins, which once welcomed over 25,000 passengers during its service years.
name: NYK Hikawa Maru
address: 山下公園地先, Yamashitacho, Naka Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 231-0023, Japan

excerpt: Yokohama district known for the boutiques & shops of the Motomachi Shopping Street.
detail_description: Motomachi is a district in Yokohama, located to the south of Chinatown. It has a rich history dating back to the Meiji Restoration when it was popular among foreigners residing in the city. Although many original buildings are no longer standing, the main shopping street still exudes a Western atmosphere and offers an array of shops, restaurants, and cafes.
name: Motomachi
address: Naka Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 231-0861, Japan

excerpt: Iconic waterfront tower & lighthouse built in 1961, with an observation deck for harbor views.
detail_description: Yokohama Marine Tower, a prominent waterfront landmark and lighthouse constructed in 1961, features an observation deck offering stunning views of the harbor. Standing at a height of 106 meters (348 feet), this lattice tower was temporarily closed in 2006 but underwent restoration, reopening to the public on Yokohama's 150th anniversary in 2009.
name: Yokohama Marine Tower
address: 14-1 Yamashitacho, Naka Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 231-0023, Japan

excerpt: This large brewery offers tours of its facility as well as a tasting room to sample the beers.
detail_description: The Kirin Brewery Yokohama Factory is a major and renowned beer brewery in Japan, with its origins dating back to 1885 in Yokohama. The facility offers daily tours, except on Mondays, where visitors can explore the manufacturing process and history of Kirin beers. The tour lasts approximately 80 minutes and includes a 20-minute tasting session. Visitors can witness the production line in action and sample various types of Kirin beer at the tasting bar.
name: Kirin Brewery Yokohama
address: 1 Chome-17-1 Namamugi, Tsurumi Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 230-8628, Japan

detail_description: Located on top of the Osanbashi Yokohama International Passenger Terminal, the Osanbashi Pier Building features a stunning 24-hour rooftop plaza offering breathtaking views of the port city. From here, visitors can admire the picturesque sight of numerous ferries and ships docked against the backdrop of the city.
name: Osanbashi Pier Building
address: 1 Chome-1 Kaigandori, Naka Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 231-0002, Japan

excerpt: Vast seaside area featuring a high-rise observation deck, boutiques, bars & a large Ferris wheel.
detail_description: Minato Mirai, which translates to "harbor of the future," is a stunning waterfront area in Yokohama that has transformed from an old shipyard into a vibrant hub since the 1980s. This picturesque locale boasts high-rise observation decks, chic boutiques, lively bars, and even a large Ferris wheel that offers breathtaking views.
name: Minatomirai
address: Nishi Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 220-0012, Japan

excerpt: Huge indoor mall featuring specialty shops & casual eateries, plus an arcade & a movie theater.
detail_description: Yokohama World Porters is a massive indoor mall located in the Minato Mirai 21 district of Yokohama. It's part of a vibrant area that includes popular attractions like the Yokohama Museum of Art, Cosmo World, and the Cup Noodle Museum, as well as several large shopping centers. The mall itself boasts around 210 unique stores spread across different categories on its six floors.
name: Yokohama World Porters
address: 2 Chome-2-1 Shinko, Naka Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 231-0001, Japan

excerpt: This museum has exhibits & reading material related to Yokohama's development as a port city.
detail_description: The Yokohama Archives of History Museum is a research facility dedicated to preserving and showcasing the historical development of Yokohama as a port city. It houses an extensive collection of documents, photographs, and maps dating back to the late 19th century when Yokohama first opened to foreign trade.
name: Yokohama Archives of History Museum
address: 3 Nihonodori, Naka Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 231-0021, Japan

detail_description: The Yokohama Noh Theater, managed by the Yokohama Municipal Arts Promotion Foundation, has gained recognition for its innovative approach to Noh theater production. It received prestigious awards such as the Saikasho and JAFRA Award for its new working model and innovation in public-sector cultural facilities. The theater aims to make Noh accessible to a wider audience with its catchphrase 'A Noh Theater that is accessible and easy to enter.'
name: Yokohama Noh Theater
address: 27-2 Momijigaoka, Nishi Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 220-0044, Japan

excerpt: Old-fashioned ship museum where visitors can explore the captain's office, crew cabins & more.
detail_description: Sail Training Ship Nippon Maru, located in Yokohama's Minato Mirai area, is a unique museum ship that offers visitors the chance to explore the captain's office, crew cabins, and more. The ship was formerly a training vessel for naval cadets and now serves as a museum showcasing its rich history.
name: Sail Training Ship Nippon Maru
address: 2 Chome-1-1 Minatomirai, Nishi Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 220-0012, Japan

excerpt: Complex devoted to the Gundam animated franchise, with a huge moving robot plus a shop & a cafe.
detail_description: Gundam Factory Yokohama is a must-visit complex for fans of the Gundam animated franchise. It features a meticulously designed, 18-meter tall, life-sized moving robot that has been attracting visitors from around the world since its opening in December 2020. The giant robot moves every hour, offering an awe-inspiring experience during the 'startup experiment.'
name: Gundam Factory Yokohama
address: 279-25 Yamashitacho, Naka Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 231-0023, Japan

excerpt: Cozy island offering hot springs, an English-style garden, a sacred shrine, caves & a lighthouse.
detail_description: Enoshima is a charming island that boasts hot springs, an English-style garden, a sacred shrine, caves, and a lighthouse. One of its most famous events is the annual illumination, which is considered one of Japan's top three light-up events. The island features about 10 illumination spots including the Enoshima Shrine and the iconic Enoshima Sea Candle lighthouse adorned with stunning lights resembling Mt. Fuji's silhouette.
name: Enoshima
address: Fujisawa, Kanagawa 251-0036, Japan

excerpt: Japan's largest stadium with a capacity of 70,000 hosting regular international & J League fixtures.
detail_description: Nissan Stadium, Japan's largest stadium with a seating capacity of 72,327, is a popular venue for international and J League fixtures. It hosts regular football games and rugby matches throughout the year. The stadium is also home to Yokohama F Marinos, part of Manchester City's City Football Group stable. Additionally, it serves as a venue for baseball games at the nearby Yokohama Stadium. Visitors can take guided tours of the stadium when events are not taking place.
name: Nissan Stadium
address: 3300 Kozukuecho, Kohoku Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 222-0036, Japan

excerpt: Maritime history museum showcasing diverse exhibits dedicated to the country's shipping industry.
detail_description: Located in Yokohama, the NYK Maritime Museum is a tribute to Japan's maritime history and the Nippon Yusen Kaisha (NYK) shipping company. As the first Japanese company to operate a passenger liner service, NYK's legacy is showcased through an array of exhibits featuring original brochures, photographs, postcards, uniforms, maps, and scale model ships. Visitors can immerse themselves in the rich history of Japan's shipping industry at this museum.
name: NYK Maritime Museum
address: 3 Chome-９ Kaigandori, Naka Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 231-0002, Japan

excerpt: Stylish, modern open-air mall in a bayside setting with upscale international shops & restaurants.
detail_description: Marine & Walk Yokohama is a stylish and modern open-air mall located in the Minato Mirai 21 district of Yokohama. It offers a bayside setting with upscale international shops, trendy independent boutiques, and casual eateries. The mall is pet-friendly and provides a breezy shopping experience compared to indoor centers. Visitors can also enjoy the nearby attractions such as the Yokohama Museum of Art, Cosmo World, and the Cup Noodle Museum.
name: Marine & Walk Yokohama
address: 1 Chome-3-1 Shinko, Naka Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 231-0001, Japan

detail_description: Yokohama Minato Mirai Hall, located in Queen Square Yokohama, Nishi Ward, Kanagawa Prefecture, is a renowned municipal concert venue known for its musical performances. The hall features a large main hall with 2020 seats and a smaller rectangular hall with 400 seats. It offers stunning views of the Port and is equipped with a remarkable pipe organ nicknamed Lucy. This symbol of Yokohama was crafted in Boston and resembles a flying seagull.
name: Yokohama Minato Mirai Hall
address: 2 Chome-3-6 Minatomirai, Nishi Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 220-0012, Japan

excerpt: Yokohama Port is visible across the water from this large city park with lawns & concreted areas.
detail_description: Rinko Park is a spacious and picturesque city park located at the tip of Minato Mirai in Yokohama. It offers stunning views of Yokohama Port and downtown, making it a popular spot for leisurely walks and impromptu picnics. The park features lush greenery, art installations, and a small pond, providing a serene escape within the modern Minato Mirai district. Visitors can also enjoy the beautiful evening city lights as they spread out across the harbor.
name: Rinko Park
address: 1 Chome-1-1 Minatomirai, Nishi Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 220-0012, Japan

excerpt: Quirky museum for young kids, with workshops & play areas featuring cartoon character Anpanman.
detail_description: Yokohama Anpanman Children's Museum is a delightful attraction for young kids and fans of the popular Japanese anime and Manga series 'Anpanman.' The museum features workshops, play areas, and adorable Anpanman-themed restaurants and shops. Visitors can enjoy Anpanman character bread at the bakery, indulge in Anpanman-themed treats at the food court, and even design their own birthday cake. The museum offers an entertaining experience for children with its engaging shows and interactive activities.
name: Yokohama Anpanman Children's Museum
address: 6 Chome-2-9 Minatomirai, Nishi Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 220-0012, Japan

detail_description: Yokohama Bay Bridge is a modern cable-stay bridge that offers stunning views of Yokohama City. It's a highlight of the area and can be admired during a full-day trip from Tokyo, which also includes lunch in Yokohama's Chinatown and a visit to the traditional Japanese-style sunken garden of Sankei-en. Additionally, there are walking tours available that pass by historic temples and shrines, offering wonderful panoramas from hiking trails with views in all directions.
name: Yokohama Bay Bridge
address: Honmokufuto, Naka Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 231-0811, Japan

excerpt: Top-floor viewing area with panoramic city vistas, plus a cafe & shops, with ticketed entry.
detail_description: The Sky Garden, perched atop the iconic Yokohama Landmark Tower, offers an unforgettable experience with its breathtaking panoramic views of the city and beyond. Visitors can ascend to this stunning observation deck in Japan's fastest elevator, reaching speeds of 45 km/h and arriving in just 40 seconds. From here, you can gaze out over the vibrant cityscape that includes landmarks like the Cosmo World Ferris wheel and even catch a glimpse of majestic Mt. Fuji on clear days.
name: The Sky Garden, Yokohama Landmark Tower
address: Yokohama Landmark Tower, 69F, 2 Chome-2-1 Minatomirai, Nishi Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 220-0012, Japan

excerpt: Train museum with model trains from a 6,000-strong collection moving through realistic dioramas.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Yokohama, the Hara Model Railway Museum is a treasure trove for train enthusiasts and casual visitors alike. With an impressive collection of over 6,000 model trains, this museum offers a captivating glimpse into the world of railways through meticulously crafted dioramas that depict vibrant cityscapes bustling with miniature trains. The museum not only showcases these intricate models but also provides insights into their history and various types.
name: Hara Model Railway Museum
address: YOKOHAMA MITSUI BUILDING, 2F, 1 Chome-1-2 Takashima, Nishi Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 220-0011, Japan

excerpt: Intimate zoo within a larger park offering 90 species, including tigers, plus a kids' petting zoo.
detail_description: Nestled within the scenic Nogeyama Park, the Nogeyama Zoological Gardens is a delightful destination for animal lovers and families alike. Established in 1951, this charming zoo boasts an impressive collection of over 90 species, including majestic lions and tigers that will surely captivate your imagination. For younger visitors, there's a petting area where kids can interact with friendly creatures like guinea pigs and mice at Nakayoshi Hiroba—just remember to grab a numbered ticket for entry!
name: Nogeyama Zoological Gardens
address: 63-10 Oimatsucho, Nishi Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 220-0032, Japan

excerpt: Once used as a rail line, this boardwalk features three bridges & sweeping views of Yokohama.
detail_description: Kishamichi Promenade is a captivating pedestrian pathway that links the Nippon-maru Memorial Park area near Sakuragicho station to the Shinko District, home to attractions like the World Porters shopping center and Cosmo Clock amusement park. This former rail line, in operation from 1911 to 1986, now offers sweeping views of Yokohama Bay and features three historic bridges dating back to 1906-1907.
name: Kishamichi Promenade
address: 2 Chome-9 Shinko, Naka Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 231-0001, Japan

excerpt: Modern science center with a variety of hands-on exhibits on technology, space & the environment.
detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant Minato Mirai area of Yokohama, the Mitsubishi Minatomirai Industrial Museum is a treasure trove for tech enthusiasts and curious minds alike. This modern science center invites visitors to dive into Japan's rich industrial heritage through an array of engaging hands-on exhibits that span technology, space, and environmental themes.
name: Mitsubishi Minatomirai Industrial Museum
address: KDX 横浜みなとみらいタワ, 3 Chome-3-1 Minatomirai, Nishi Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 220-8401, Japan

excerpt: Kamakura is a seaside Japanese city just south of Tokyo. The political center of medieval Japan, modern-day Kamakura is a prominent resort town with dozens of Buddhist Zen temples and Shinto shrines. Its most recognizable landmark is the Kotoku-in Temple’s Great Buddha, a roughly 13m-high bronze statue still standing after a 15th-century tsunami. Yuigahama Beach on Sagami Bay is a popular surfing spot.
detail_description: Kamakura, a coastal city in Japan, is steeped in history as the former political hub of medieval Japan. Today, it's a popular resort destination adorned with numerous Zen temples and Shinto shrines. One of its most iconic attractions is the Great Buddha at Kotoku-in Temple, a towering bronze statue that survived a 15th-century tsunami. Additionally, Yuigahama Beach draws surfers to its shores.
name: Kamakura
address: Kanagawa, Japan

excerpt: Sleek showroom with racing & vintage cars alongside new models, plus tech displays & a gift shop.
detail_description: Nestled within the impressive Nissan World Headquarters building, the Nissan Global Headquarters Gallery is a must-visit for car enthusiasts and families alike. Just a short stroll from Yokohama Station, this sleek showroom showcases an exciting blend of cutting-edge new models alongside vintage racing cars that tell the story of automotive history. Visitors can immerse themselves in interactive tech displays and even try their hand at driving simulators. For those with an international driving license, there's an opportunity to take select models for a complimentary test drive!
name: Nissan Global Headquarters Gallery
address: 日産自動車グローバル本社 １F, 1 Chome-1-1 Takashima, Nishi Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 220-8686, Japan

detail_description: Yokohama Station is the largest railway terminal in Yokohama, providing access to multiple JR lines, private railway lines, and a subway line. Situated in downtown Yokohama, it is surrounded by various commercial facilities including renowned department stores like Yokohama Takashimaya and Sogo Yokohama. The area also features discount shops and major electronics retailers, offering a wide range of Japanese products such as kimono, accessories, sweets, cosmetics, and electronics.
name: Yokohama Station
address: 2 Chome Takashima, Nishi Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 220-0011, Japan

excerpt: Vast shopping, dining & entertainment complex spread across 3 towers, with hundreds of stores.
detail_description: Queen's Square Yokohama is a vast shopping, dining, and entertainment complex spread across three towers in the Minato Mirai 21 district. It is part of a popular area that includes attractions like the Yokohama Museum of Art, Cosmo World, and the Cup Noodle Museum. The complex houses hundreds of stores covering various categories and features big-name global brands in Tokyu Square. Additionally, it offers convenient access as it is located directly above Minatomirai station.
name: Queen's Square Yokohama
address: 2 Chome-3 Minatomirai, Nishi Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 220-0012, Japan

excerpt: Stately domed building dating to 1904 with displays of centuries-old clay horses & Buddhist statues.
detail_description: The Kanagawa Prefectural Museum of Cultural History, housed in a grand domed building dating back to 1904, offers a captivating journey through Japan's rich heritage. Located near Bashamichi Station and within walking distance from Kan'nai Station, this historic gem is an Important Cultural Property of Japan. Visitors can explore centuries-old clay horses, Buddhist statues, and other cultural artifacts.
name: Kanagawa Prefectural Museum of Cultural History
address: 5 Chome-60 Minaminakadori, Naka Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 231-0006, Japan

detail_description: Yokohama Nigiwai-za is an entertainment theater situated in the Minato Mirai 21 & Sakuragi-cho area. The 400-seat auditorium hosts a variety of performances including rakugo, comic storytelling, and stand-up comedy. The venue also features street performers and shakuhachi musicians. Despite its unusual structure for a vaudeville venue, it offers an intimate experience with the performers.
name: Yokohama Nigiwai-za
address: 3 Chome-110-1 Nogecho, Naka Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 231-0064, Japan

excerpt: Ferris wheel & clock offering birds-eye views of city & harbor, with tablets for sightseeing info.
detail_description: Cosmo Clock 21 is a famous Ferris wheel and clock in Yokohama, Japan. It was built for the Yokohama Expo in 1989 and was once the largest Ferris wheel in the world. Even today, it remains one of the largest, standing at a towering height of 112 meters overlooking the bayside. Visitors can enjoy breathtaking panoramic views of the city and harbor from its capsules equipped with tablets providing sightseeing information.
name: Cosmo Clock 21
address: よこはまコスモワールド, 2 Chome-8-1 Shinko, Naka Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 231-0001, Japan

excerpt: Utilitarian dorms & private rooms in a casual hostel offering a lounge with a library.
detail_description: GuestHouse FUTARENO is a charming traditional Japanese-style wooden hostel located in the Noge district of Yokohama. It offers utilitarian dorms and private rooms, providing a cozy atmosphere with free WiFi throughout the property. The hostel's strategic location allows easy access to various attractions such as Nogeyama Zoo and beautiful views of Yokohama City from the nearby park.
name: GuestHouse FUTARENO
address: Japan, 〒231-0064 Kanagawa, Yokohama, Naka Ward, Nogecho, 4 Chome−173-5

excerpt: Sleek lodging offering plush rooms & suites, plus 6 eateries, an indoor pool & a tea room.
detail_description: Yokohama Royal Park Hotel is a luxurious accommodation located in the Landmark Tower, offering stunning views of Yokohama Bay and the city. The hotel features elegant and spacious rooms, along with top-notch dining options including six eateries serving a variety of cuisines. Guests can also enjoy amenities such as an indoor pool and a tea room.
name: Yokohama Royal Park Hotel
address: 2 Chome-2-1-3 Minatomirai, Nishi Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 220-0012, Japan

excerpt: Polished rooms & suites in an ornate 1920's lodging with a spa, 4 restaurants & 2 bars.
detail_description: Hotel New Grand is a luxurious 1920s establishment located in the vibrant Chinatown district of Yokohama. The hotel offers elegantly designed rooms and suites, along with a spa, four restaurants, and two bars for guests to enjoy. Situated near Yamashita Park overlooking Tokyo Bay, it provides high-end accommodation options for travelers seeking luxury experiences. One of its highlights is the signature dessert, pudding a la mode, which combines European-inspired sweets with Japanese culinary artistry.
name: Hotel New Grand
address: 10 Yamashitacho, Naka Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 231-8520, Japan
